title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Aequs to raise ₹720 crore via IPO
items.author: Dev Kachari, ETInfra
items.summary:
- Aequs Ltd plans to raise *₹720 crore* via an **IPO** (fresh issue plus offer-for-sale) to cut debt, fund capital expenditure and pursue acquisitions.
- The Belagavi-based precision manufacturer expanded into North America and France and supplies aero-structures to customers like *Airbus*, *Boeing* and *Safran*.
- Bookrunners JM Financial, IIFL Capital and Kotak Mahindra back the move as Aequs aims to bolster its role in global *aerospace* and consumer supply chains.

items.title: We believe Indian shipbuilding industry has a role to play in international shipbuilding market: Royal IHC CEO
Indian firms bid to develop AMCA 5th-gen fighter
items.summary:
- Multiple Indian firms, including HAL, L&T (with BEL) and BEML partners, have bid to **DRDO/ADA** to design the indigenous *AMCA* under a ₹15,000 crore development package.
- A committee led by *A Sivathanu Pillai* will evaluate bids and recommend partners to the Defence Ministry, with the Defence Secretary overseeing timelines.
- Production is targeted for 2034–35 with ~125 aircraft and a manufacturing value of **₹2 lakh crore**, marking a major push in *defence indigenisation*.

items.title: India-EFTA TEPA: $100B investment, 1M jobs from Oct 1
items.summary:
- *TEPA* comes into effect on Oct 1 and launches an India‑EFTA Desk as a single‑window to attract *$100 billion* in investment and create *1 million direct jobs* over 15 years.
- The agreement gives EFTA *100% non‑agri* market access (92.2% of tariff lines, 99.6% of India’s exports) while India offers 82.7% of lines, with sensitive sectors like pharma, dairy and coal protected.
- It strengthens services and tech ties (IT, renewables, life sciences), includes TRIPS‑level **IPR** commitments—Switzerland’s high IPR standards and generic medicine concerns are addressed.

items.title: India's pharma exports to top $30B by year-end
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- India’s pharma exports, currently *$27.8B*, are expected to surpass **$30B** by year-end despite a 100% US tariff effective Oct 1.
- India is *3rd by volume* and 14th by value globally, with the domestic market forecast to grow from *$60B* to **$130B** by 2030.
- India’s vaccine leadership — including the world’s first *DNA* Covid-19 vaccine, HPV efforts, and supplying vaccines to *200+ countries* — underpins its diversified pharma strength.

items.title: Deeptech startup EyeROV bags ₹47 crore order from Indian Navy
items.summary:
- The *Indian Navy* signed a **₹47 crore** contract with *EyeROV* for advanced *UWROVs*, including the 300m-capable Trout model with mission payloads. 
- Kochi-based deeptech startup founded in 2016 by IIT alumni has 100+ deployments, 80+ customers (including *DRDO* and Coast Guard) and raised over $2M. 
- The order underscores *indigenisation* in defence procurement and boosts domestic R&D in underwater robotics.

items.title: Govt monitors e‑commerce on GST rate‑cut compliance
items.summary:
- Government is monitoring *e‑commerce* platforms to ensure benefits of **GST** rate cuts on *FMCG* and daily essentials are passed to consumers.
- Authorities have informally flagged some platforms for pricing discrepancies and asked CGST officers to report MRP changes for 54 common items to **CBIC**.
- Platforms cited 'technical glitches', but increased vigilance and monthly reporting aim to prevent non‑compliance and protect consumers.

items.title: India-Sweden Innovation Day: Sustainable Partnerships
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The 12th India-Sweden Innovation Day highlighted a shared vision for *sustainable development* and collaboration across **clean energy**, **AI**, mobility, green manufacturing, and the circular economy.
- Participants showcased the *India-Sweden Industry Transition Partnership (ITP)* to drive decarbonisation in heavy industries like *steel* and *cement* alongside initiatives such as LEAD IT 2.0 and smart transport.
- Leaders stressed boosting trade, cross-border R&D, and joint innovation to scale solutions ahead of *COP 30*.

items.title: Dhoot Transmission names ex-Napino chief Naveen Kumar CEO
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Dhoot Transmission has appointed *Naveen Kumar* as Group CEO, reporting to Founder Rahul Dhoot.  
- Kumar brings 30+ years in automotive and manufacturing, including scaling revenues and strategic JVs at **Napino Auto & Electronics**.  
- The company says the hire will drive *growth, innovation,* and global competitiveness across its auto-component operations.

items.title: Rajnath Singh to launch publications on defence transparency
items.summary:
- *Rajnath Singh* will launch publications to strengthen the *CGDA* and promote *modernisation* and *transparency* in defence financial management.
- He will attend the 278th Annual Day of the Defence Accounts Department and present the *Raksha Mantri Awards for Excellence 2025*.
- The Ministry says over 200 DAD offices, 16 bank branches, nearly 5 lakh CSCs and *SPARSH* (with ~31 of 32 lakh pensioners onboarded) improve delivery of *pensions* and veteran outreach.

items.title: India's private coal power firms urge easing of China equipment curbs
IIT Delhi develops AI tool for smarter HVAC filters
items.summary:
- IIT Delhi-led researchers developed an *AI tool* that predicts performance of *HVAC filters* to improve *indoor air quality*.
- The model, trained on global experimental datasets and validated with industrial data from *Elofic Industries Ltd.*, balances filtration efficiency against airflow and energy trade-offs.
- The approach could lower energy costs and strengthen public-health preparedness in buildings, though it requires large data, compute, and has interpretability limits.

items.title: SBL Energy eyes new growth frontiers in mining, cement, and hydropower
Imec names Patrick Vandenameele CEO to lead AI chip push
items.summary:
- Imec appoints *Patrick Vandenameele* as CEO while Luc Van den hove becomes chairman to refocus the research hub on **AI chipmaking** and strengthen ties with hyperscalers like Amazon, Microsoft, Meta and Google.
- Vandenameele will push spin‑offs, earlier startup access to imec fabs and build a sub‑2nm pilot line backed by **€2.5bn EU funding** to boost European manufacturing access.
- He highlights *power efficiency* as the central problem for scaling AI in datacentres and aims to deliver sustainable, high‑performance chip solutions.

items.title: Carlsberg India to invest ₹1,250 crore over the next three years
AI simulation - India’s net-zero catalyst
India eyes tailings to boost gold output
items.author: Suryash Kumar, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India is exploring extraction of *gold from mine tailings* to boost domestic output as **gold prices** rally, potentially making tailings retreatment commercially viable.
- Tailings contain traces of gold plus other metals like *zinc* and *copper*, but extraction is costly and requires large-scale *mechanisation* to improve recoveries.
- India produced 1.62 tonnes in 2024-25 (mainly *Karnataka*), and scaling tailings recovery could help reduce imports (650–1,000 tonnes annually).

items.title: Govt extends export benefits under RoDTEP scheme till Mar 2026
Iron ore futures fall on weak China data, but log quarterly gains
Optiemus, Ordinary Theory form JV for enterprise hardware
items.summary:
- Optiemus Infracom has formed a JV with *Ordinary Theory LLC* to design, manufacture and sell **smart enterprise hardware** and integrated **industrial solutions** for payments, retail, logistics and AI.
- Optiemus will hold a majority stake and use its Indian production facilities to offer locally manufactured alternatives to international products, aiming to boost *India* as a hub for smart hardware.
- The partnership targets job creation, skill development and scaling of secure, scalable fintech and IoT devices to accelerate the country’s digital economy.

items.title: India’s factory output likely to remain weak in September after tepid August growth: India Ratings
India added 44.2 GW of solar modules, 7.5 GW of cell manufacturing capacity in 1H 2025: Report
Honeywell 13MM pressure sensor for semiconductor fabs
items.summary:
- Honeywell's 13MM Pressure Sensor is a high‑precision device for *cleanroom* and *high‑purity* manufacturing, focused on semiconductor wafer fabrication.
- It provides accurate pressure measurements under high‑pressure and high‑temperature conditions with minimal *offset drift*, and complies with **SEMI F20** metal/surface standards to cut contamination.
- Designed to boost equipment reliability, reduce wafer scrap and raise productivity, it also fits *solar*, *display*, *biopharma*, *optics*, medical and food production.

items.title: UST to bridge global chipmakers to Indian OSATs
Kellanova bets on scale, snacks to grab a bigger bite in India's breakfast market
Demand for natural gas falls as plants opt for cheaper fuels
items.author: Sanjeev Choudhary, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India's industries are switching from *natural gas* to cheaper fuels like *LPG* and **wood briquettes**, with industrial LPG use up 65% YoY in August as Asian LNG prices linger around $11/mmbtu.
- Power and refinery demand for gas fell sharply (down 20% and 19.4% respectively), driving an overall 8% decline in national gas consumption so far this fiscal.
- While city gas distributors (+8%) and petrochemicals (+37%) grew, the fuel-switch trend is forcing gas suppliers to cut rates and could reshape industrial fuel markets.

items.title: Jindal Steel commissions 3 MTPA oxygen furnace at Angul
items.summary:
- Jindal Steel has commissioned a 250 MT Basic *Oxygen Furnace* at Angul, adding **3 MTPA** to crude steel capacity and raising the site's total from 6 to *9 MTPA*. 
- The company also commissioned *Blast Furnace 2* and plans a dedicated *Paradeep* port, slurry pipeline, coal conveyor, power plant and coke ovens to target *12 MTPA* this year. 
- Management says Angul will become a major single‑site steel hub, strengthening India's domestic supply for *infrastructure*, *automotive* and energy sectors.

items.title: Hinduja Tech's 700W DC-DC converter & supercapacitor ECU
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hinduja Tech partnered with a UK Tier‑1 to develop a 700W, 12V↔48V bidirectional *DC‑DC converter* integrated with a *supercapacitor ECU* for fast‑reacting eARC actuators.
- Built on the **Infineon AURIX TC23X** with ASIL B and AUTOSAR compliance, the solution incorporates FlexRay, UDS diagnostics, and end‑to‑end virtual plus physical validation.
- The program achieved a *70–75%* reduction in design and development costs versus global benchmarks and accelerated time‑to‑market for EV platforms.

items.title: RBI allows working-capital loans to gold-using manufacturers
items.summary:
- The RBI amended rules to let banks extend need-based *working capital* loans to manufacturers using *gold* or *silver* as raw materials, expanding a carve-out previously limited to jewellers.
- Banks may accept such gold/silver as *security* but must ensure borrowers do not hold it for *investment* or speculation.
- RBI also eased interest-rate spread rules, allowed discretionary switches to fixed rates, and raised overseas PDI limits to bolster banks' Tier‑1 capital; effective Oct 1, 2025.

items.title: Man Industries shares sink 16% after Sebi bans firm, top executives for 2 years
China's factory activity contracts for 6th straight month
items.summary:
- *China's* official manufacturing *PMI* remained below 50 for the sixth straight month (49.8 in Sept), marking the longest slump since 2019.
- A private PMI rose to 51.2 and some production metrics improved, but weak domestic demand, the property slump and firms cutting prices amid *trade tensions* with the US keep growth fragile.
- The slowdown affects a large population and could prompt policy easing (rate cuts), while pressuring margins and posing risks to global supply chains.

items.title: Boeing in early stages of developing 737 MAX replacement
items.summary:
- *Boeing* is in early planning to develop a new single‑aisle airplane to eventually replace the **737 MAX**, and is designing its flight deck now.
- The company has held talks with *Rolls‑Royce* about a new engine and is prioritizing recovery tasks like delivering roughly **6,000** back‑logged jets and certifying models.
- The effort unfolds amid intense *regulatory scrutiny* — FAA actions, a past grounding, production caps and DOJ probes follow safety incidents.

items.title: India to monitor solar equipment imports with new system
items.author: Shilpa Samant, Deepshikha Sikarwar
items.summary:
- India plans a dedicated import monitoring system to track *solar* equipment by content, origin and HS codes to improve visibility and compliance. 
- The system may require advance declarations and automatic registration before customs, mirroring controls on steel and paper to enforce **ALMM** and boost *domestic manufacturing*. 
- India’s module capacity has crossed 100 GW and could reach 200 GW by FY28, raising export uncertainties and supply‑chain implications.

items.title: India probes Chinese imports of solar cell components
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The Commerce Ministry arm *DGTR* has launched an *anti-dumping* probe into imports of *solar encapsulants* (excluding EVA) and mobile covers from *China* after complaints by RenewSys India and the All India Mobile Cover Manufacturer Association.
- If *dumping* is established, *DGTR* will recommend import *levies* to curb injury to domestic players, with the Finance Ministry making the final decision.
- Separately, *DGTR* opened a *countervailing duty* probe into *clear float glass* imports from Malaysia and Indonesia over alleged subsidisation harming local producers.

items.title: L&T secures $700M sustainability-linked trade facility
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- L&T has secured a *$700 million* Sustainability-Linked Trade Facility (SLTF) from *Standard Chartered*, aligned with Loan Market Association sustainability principles.
- The SLTF ties pricing to sustainability *KPIs* such as greenhouse gas emission intensity and freshwater withdrawal targets crucial to L&T's operations.
- This follows L&T's earlier *$60 million* sustainability bond and strengthens ESG-linked financing across its global EPC and manufacturing businesses.

items.title: Tata Steel pact with Dutch govt to cut carbon at IJmuiden
items.summary:
- Tata Steel signed a non-binding pact with the Dutch government to transition the *IJmuiden* plant to *low-carbon* steel production.
- The government intends to provide up to **€2 billion**, while Tata Steel Nederland has applied to the *EU Innovation Fund* for **€0.3 billion**.
- Total expenditure is not finalised; remaining costs are expected to come from Tata Steel Nederland's cash, project financing debt and funding by Tata Steel.

items.title: ArcelorMittal–Nippon Steel to build ₹1.47L-cr plant in Vizag
items.author: Siva G, TIMESOFINDIA.COM
items.summary:
- The *ArcelorMittal–Nippon Steel* joint venture will build a **₹1.47 lakh crore** steel complex near *Visakhapatnam*, targeting 8.2 Mtpa initially and 10.5 Mtpa by 2033.
- The project is phased with a captive port (five berths in phase one, 12 in phase two) and is expected to generate about *61,000* jobs plus *8,000* at the port.
- Public hearings recorded no outright opposition but demanded better *compensation* and employment guarantees as the state plans ~*4,000 acres* for phase two.

items.title: BSNL 4G project needed 16x jump in BTS manufacturing capacity: Tejas Networks’ Sanjay Malik
What manufacturers can learn from Lighthouse Network
Swan Defence and Heavy Industries and Samsung Heavy Industries sign MoU to collaborate on shipbuilding
Vodafone Idea’s enterprise arm partners AWS, C-DoT for IoT innovation lab in Mumbai
US drug recalls: Glenmark, Granules, Sun Pharma and others
items.summary:
- Indian drugmakers including *Glenmark*, *Granules India*, *Sun Pharma*, *Zydus* and *Unichem* are voluntarily recalling products in the US over *manufacturing issues*, the *USFDA* Enforcement Report says.
- Glenmark Pharmaceuticals USA initiated a Class II recall on Sept 17 for 13,824 tubes of *Azelaic Acid Gel* made at its Goa plant due to *CGMP deviations* and consumer complaints of a gritty texture.
- The recalls expose compliance gaps for Indian exporters, may disrupt US supply chains, and could prompt heightened *regulatory scrutiny* and reputational impact long-term.

items.title: Premier Energies secures $20 mn solar contracts in West Africa
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Premier Energies won *$19.95 million* contracts to install **750 rooftop solar systems**, over **4,400** solar streetlights and **650** solar water heaters across the Republic of Benin.
- The work, funded via a Line of Credit from *EXIM Bank* and the *ECOWAS Bank (EBID)* and implemented with Benin’s energy ministry, aims to boost community safety, healthcare, education and energy access.
- The Hyderabad-based firm is expanding manufacturing to *8.4 GW* (cells) and *11.1 GW* (modules) by June 2026 and moving into batteries, wafers and inverters.

items.title: Moët Hennessy India appoints Siddharth Suri as Managing Director
PM Modi to inaugurate CM's short-term employability courses programme
Axiscades gets defence order to supply drones to Indian Army
Auto components, FMCG, defence among 9 sectors set to benefit from festive demand
GST rationalisation to augur well for manufacturing output in September-October
Electronics manufacturing to become major employer: Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- *Electronics manufacturing* in *India* is expanding rapidly with new suppliers and growing *design capabilities*, driven mainly by small and medium enterprises.
- The sector is poised to become a major *employment* source as India shifts from assembly to advanced chip design, highlighted by ARM's Bengaluru office and a homegrown **2nm** chip effort.
- Strong government backing — including the *India Semiconductor Mission* (₹76,000 crore), 10 approved projects (₹1.6 lakh crore) and DLI-supported startups — is accelerating the ecosystem.

items.title: Dynabook begins soft launch of laptop assembly at Syrma SGS facility
